text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/b806aa5bd910dba94fbde586f6019b4825813d28|patch 8.2.1673: complete_info() selected index has an invalid value>
patch 8.2.1673: complete_info() selected index has an invalid value

Problem:    complete_info() selected index has an invalid value. (Ben Jackson)
Solution:   Set the index when there is only one match. (closes #6945)
            Add test for complete_info().

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1673: complete_info() selected index has an invalid value · vim/vim@b806aa5
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1673: complete_info() selected index has an invalid value · vim/vim@b806aa5
attachments.text: Problem: complete_info() selected index has an invalid value. (Ben Jackson) Solution: Set the index when there is only one match. (closes #6945) Add test for complete_info().

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/4a091b9978122428e7d9154d034c640c9c8d8c13|patch 8.2.1672: v_lock is used when it is not initialized>
patch 8.2.1672: v_lock is used when it is not initialized

Problem:    v_lock is used when it is not initialized. (Yegappan Lakshmanan)
Solution:   Initialize the typval in eval1().

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1672: v_lock is used when it is not initialized · vim/vim@4a091b9
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1672: v_lock is used when it is not initialized · vim/vim@4a091b9
attachments.text: Problem: v_lock is used when it is not initialized. (Yegappan Lakshmanan) Solution: Initialize the typval in eval1().

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/c6e57b74fa1e6090a27f886e2b3830fd1fa15708|patch 8.2.1671: Vim9: stray error for missing white space>
patch 8.2.1671: Vim9: stray error for missing white space

Problem:    Vim9: stray error for missing white space.
Solution:   Do not skip over white space after member. (closes #6817)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1671: Vim9: stray error for missing white space · vim/vim@c6e57b7
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1671: Vim9: stray error for missing white space · vim/vim@c6e57b7
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: stray error for missing white space. Solution: Do not skip over white space after member. (closes #6817)

patch 8.2.1670: a couple of gcc compiler warnings

Problem:    A couple of gcc compiler warnings.
Solution:   Initialize local variables. (Dominique Pellé, closes #6944)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/b0fa5e17c587d9c71596bd10836918af713ffff6|patch 8.2.1669: Vim9: memory leak when storing a value fails>
patch 8.2.1669: Vim9: memory leak when storing a value fails

Problem:    Vim9: memory leak when storing a value fails.
Solution:   Free the value when not storing it.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1669: Vim9: memory leak when storing a value fails · vim/vim@b0fa5e1
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1669: Vim9: memory leak when storing a value fails · vim/vim@b0fa5e1
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: memory leak when storing a value fails. Solution: Free the value when not storing it.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/dadaddd59f3b53c41e92dc42219ab006deb14109|patch 8.2.1668: Vim9: not accepting 0 or 1 as bool when type is any>
patch 8.2.1668: Vim9: not accepting 0 or 1 as bool when type is any

Problem:    Vim9: not accepting 0 or 1 as bool when type is any.
Solution:   Convert the type with the CHECKTYPE instruction. (closes #6913)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1668: Vim9: not accepting 0 or 1 as bool when type is any · vim/vim@dadaddd
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1668: Vim9: not accepting 0 or 1 as bool when type is any · vim/vim@dadaddd
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: not accepting 0 or 1 as bool when type is any. Solution: Convert the type with the CHECKTYPE instruction. (closes #6913)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/0f769815c82bf93812842e1ad56fcc52c10ff3e5|patch 8.2.1667: local function name cannot shadow a global function name>
patch 8.2.1667: local function name cannot shadow a global function name

Problem:    Local function name cannot shadow a global function name.
Solution:   Ignore global functions when checking a script-local or scoped
            function name. (closes #6926)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1667: local function name cannot shadow a global function name · vim/vim@0f76981
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1667: local function name cannot shadow a global function name · vim/vim@0f76981
attachments.text: Problem: Local function name cannot shadow a global function name. Solution: Ignore global functions when checking a script-local or scoped function name. (closes #6926)
